national_indicators_available:
• Contracting Parties to the International Treaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture
  • Parties to the Nagoya Protocol
  • Countries that have legislative, administrative and policy framework or measures reported through the Online Reporting System on Compliance of the International Treaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture
  • Countries that have legislative, administrative and policy framework or measures reported to the Access and Benefit-Sharing Clearing-House
  • Number of Standard Material Transfer Agreements (SMTAs)
comparison_sdg: The time series are compliant with the global metadata.
goal_meta_national_link_text: Metadata on the presented time series
indicator_name: Number of countries that have adopted legislative, administrative and policy frameworks to ensure fair and equitable sharing of benefits
target_name: Promote fair and equitable sharing of the benefits arising from the utilization of genetic resources and promote appropriate access to such resources, as internationally agreed
un_designated_tier: Tier I
un_custodian_agency: Secretariat of the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD-Secretariat)
source_organisation_1: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)
source_organisation_2: Secretariat of the Convention on Biological Diversity
data_footnotes:
Parties to the Nagoya Protocol: Data is only available from 2016.
• Countries that have legislative, administrative and policy framework or measures reported through the Online Reporting System on Compliance of the International Treaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture: The time series refers to the online reporting system. The framework and measures existed before. Data is only available from 2016.
• Number of Standard Material Transfer Agreements (SMTAs): Cummulative values. Data is only available from 2012.
